title.narrative: Provision of primary health care and physical rehabilitation services for returnees and community in East Aleppo

description.narrative: Since the onset of this new displacement, UNHCR was hand-in-hand with its partners providing protection services and humanitarian assistance to the uprooted families and responding to their urgent needs. The majority of the people displaced from eastern Aleppo are women-headed households, separated/unaccompanied children, and elderly persons, persons with disabilities and persons with medical conditions who require particular assistance. The displaced population are in dire need of relief and urgent humanitarian and health assistance to save and sustain their lives. Primary health care is a key response in health in emergencies. The project aims at ensuring access of the returnees and those who have remained in EA to a comprehensive package of free of charge primary health care services. Additionally, it aims to addressing the huge needs to physical rehabilitation for the vulnerable group of the disabled in the area through a static physical rehabilitation clinic located in the PHC, and two mobile teams for physical rehabilitation to reach the most vulnerable who are, in most of the cases, unable to reach the service. The project will ensure the access of PoCs in East Aleppo to free of charge primary health care services that include medical consultation (internal, gynecology, and pediatric clinics), basic laboratory investigations, medicines provision for the most common acute and chronic diseases, mental health and psychosocial support services through a multidisciplinary team of MHPSS professionals, in addition to health promotion and disease prevention activities through a strong link with outreach volunteers of other partners and community centers in the area. Networking with other partners in the area is essential to ensure referral to other services and the capacity building of the staff in the clinical and MHPSS care for GBV survivors which are also essential components in this project. The project will contribute to the re-establishment of the health system in East Aleppo and to the reconstruction /rehabilitation efforts which are a corner stone in the provision of sustainable health services.
